details.title: Read up on all COVID-19 updates of August 16 here!
details.content: Chennai sees over 3000 new cases in last 72 hours; liquor shops to reopen in city from Tuesday. The liquor outlets will be functioning from 10 am to 7 pm. The customers must wear masks and they should maintain social distancing while visiting/waiting at the liquor outlets. (READ ALL UPDATES HERE)

details.title: IN PICS | COVID-19 protocols in temples is the 'new normal'
details.content:
Kerala: Lord Ayyappa temple in Sabarimala opened yesterday on the eve of the monthly five-day puja for the Malayalam month of Chingam. The puja will start from today morning and the bar on devotees' entry will continue as per COVID-19 protocol. pic.twitter.com/PH8eyGJ2IY

— ANI (@ANI) August 17, 2020

details.title: Tamil Nadu | Over 80 % of patients recover from coronavirus in 13 districts
details.content:
• Despite the steady rise of COVID-19 cases in Tamil Nadu, over 80 per cent people in 13 districts of the state have recovered
  • Experts say that while recovery could be high in the urban cities due to early exposure to the virus, a spike in second and third-tier districts was always expected
  • (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Hitting COVID-19 for a six: Cricket, carrom, cards keep asymptomatic patients in Madurai in relaxed mood
details.content:
Some patients are even bringing DVDs to make their 10-day stay at the centre enjoyable. The health department is also encouraging them by equipping the centres with projectors and DVD players.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Low-key Vinayaka Chaturthi to be observed across states keeping COVID-19 in mind
details.content: (Photo | P Jawahar, EPS)

details.title: Mandya gets its first plasma bank amid rise in cases in neighbouring Karnataka districts
details.content:
The old Mysuru region has got its first plasma bank for Covid treatment at Mandya. This will help those in Hassan, Mysuru, Mandya and Chamarajanagar, where there have been a high number of cases.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: COVID-19 surge continues in Kerala, 3,138 new cases in two days due to local transmission
details.content:
The official death tally has crossed the 150-mark with the recording of 10 more deaths on the day. The death tally now stands at 156. There are 15,310 active cases in the state.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: WATCH | Brazil's Christ the Redeemer gets visitors again
details.content:
VIDEO: Tourists gather at a viewpoint atop Rio de Janeiro's Corcovado Mountain and visit the statue of Christ the Redeemer, one of the Brazilian city's main attractions, as it reopens to the public after remaining closed for months due to the COVID-19 pandemic pic.twitter.com/AA3P3AX3zF

— AFP news agency (@AFP) August 17, 2020

details.title: Total coronavirus recoveries cross two-lakh in Andhra Pradesh, 86,000 more to go
details.content:
According to a media bulletin released by the State Command Control Centre, 48,746 more samples were tested, out of which 8,012 returned positive.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Spike of 57,982 cases and 941 deaths reported in India in the last 24-hours
COVID-19 death toll rises to 50,921; more than 3 crore tests conducted: Health Ministry
details.content:
As tally rose to 26,47,664, the MoHFW took to Twitter to share that the country has conducted more than 3 crore tests. The ministry added that aggressive testing lead to early identification and isolation of COVID-19 cases.

details.title: As Telangana shrinks testing over weekend, just 894 cases of Covid detected
details.content:
Owing to the lesser tests, districts like GHMC, Rangareddy, Medchal, Warangal Urban which have been reporting a high number of cases before, running into triple digits have reported only 147; 85; 51; 44 cases respectively.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Global update | After record single-day spike since May, South Koreans asked to remain indoors
details.content:
The 279 new cases reported Sunday was South Korea's biggest single-day jump since early May amid concerns about an outbreak in the densely populated Seoul metropolitan area.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Global update | New Zealand PM delays election after coronavirus return
details.content:
Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern on Monday delayed New Zealand's looming election by four weeks to October 17 after a renewed coronavirus outbreak hampered campaigning.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Global update | Japan's economy shrinks at record rate, slammed by COVID-19 pandemic
details.content:
The world's third-largest economy was already ailing when the virus outbreak struck late last year. The fallout has since gradually worsened both in COVID-19 cases and social distancing restrictions.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: 362 COVID-19 positive cases, one death: Poojapura jail a major worry for Kerala govt
details.content:
So far, 362 people have contracted the infection, of whom three are prison staff and the remaining are prisoners. A total of 298 antigen tests were conducted among the prison staff and jail inmates on Sunday.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: India COVID-19 toll stands at  50,921: Union Health Ministry
details.content:
#UPDATE India's death toll from the #coronavirus hits 50,000, with more than 900 new fatalities reported in 24 hours, health ministry data shows.

The country last week overtook Britain with the world's fourth-highest number of deaths, behind the United States, Brazil and Mexico pic.twitter.com/lOy5cONA4n

— AFP news agency (@AFP) August 17, 2020

details.title: In COVID-19 treatment, SP Balasubrahmanyam showed thumbs up to doctors
details.content:
In a video message, the singer's son Charan said there is improvement in his father's health. He is responding to doctors treatment and showed thumbs up to them. He is still in ICU, but his condition is stable. It may take time for his recovery. It may not happen in a day or two but will take some time, Charan added.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: West Bengal TMC MLA Samaresh Das succumbs to COVID-19
details.content:
West Bengal: Trinamool Congress (TMC) MLA from Egra, Samaresh Das passed away today in Kolkata. He had co-morbidities and had tested positive for #COVID19.

— ANI (@ANI) August 17, 2020

details.title: Patients in need of urgent treatment avoiding hospital visits due to COVID fears: Doctors
details.content:
Dr Mandeep S Malhotra, Head of Department - Head, Neck and Breast Oncoplasty at Fortis Hospital Vasant Kunj, said two of his patients -- an IAS officer and an IT consultant, both aged 45 -- had palpable breast lumps in March. Due to fear of COVID-19, they neither reported to the hospital nor to their gynaecologists or family doctors and are now in Stage 4 of breast cancer.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Close to 62,000 positive cases in Rajasthan
details.content:
693 new #COVID19 cases and 10 deaths reported in Rajasthan. Total number of cases now at 61,989 including 14,451 active cases, 46,652 recoveries and 886 deaths: State Health Department pic.twitter.com/ikkzekdhvN

— ANI (@ANI) August 17, 2020

details.title: Four persons at NCP chief Sharad Pawar's Mumbai residence test COVID-19 positive
details.content:
Pawar's test results have come out negative, but he will be asked not to go on any state tour for next some days, Tope told reporters. "Two people, including a cook, and two security guards at Pawar's 'Silver Oak' residence here have tested positive for coronavirus," the minister said.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Former President remains critical, has also tested positive for COVID-19
details.content:
MEDICAL BULLETIN: 17 AUG

The condition of Hon’ble Shri Pranab Mukherjee continues to be critical. His vital and clinical parameters are stable. He is on ventilatory support and is being closely monitored: Army Hospital (R&R)@NewIndianXpress @TheMornStandard

— Mayank (@scribesoldier) August 17, 2020

details.title: Post recovery, patients continue to suffer from COVID-19 symptoms in Karnataka
details.content:
Mild Covid patients often face tiredness, fatigue, myalgia (muscle ache), weakness and lethargy for a week to 10 days, but they do not need medicines, said Dr Ravindra Mehta, senior consultant and HoD, Pulmonology and Interventional Pulmonology, Apollo Speciality Hospitals.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Auto-generated e-pass from today onwards in Tamil Nadu
details.content:
From today, e-pass for inter district travel is auto generated and the system starts right away for people coming from other districts to Chennai, says Corporation Commissioner G Prakash. He advises citizens to use this for genuine purposes only. @xpresstn @NewIndianXpress

— Omjasvin M D (@omjasvinMD) August 17, 2020

details.title: Samaresh Das, second MLA of the ruling TMC to die since June due to COVID-19
details.content:
Trinamool Congress MLA Samaresh Das, who had tested positive for COVID-19 recently, died at a hospital in West Bengal's East Midnapore district on Monday, party sources said.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: COVID-19 tests in India cross 3 crore mark
details.content:
• The total number of tests for detection of COVID-19 has crossed the 3 crore mark in India
  • A total of 3,00,41,400 samples have been tested until August 16 with 7,31,697 samples being tested on Sunday
  • 'Focussing on timely and aggressive testing, India has exceeded 3 crore tests,' the Health Ministry tweeted

(Inputs from PTI)

details.title: JUST IN | DMK, AMMK oppose Tamil Nadu govt's decision to open TASMAC amid rising COVID-19 cases
details.content:
DMK president MK Stalin and AMMK general secretary TTV Dhinakran condemned the state government for opening of TASMAC liquor outlets in Chennai.

(Inputs from ENS)

details.title: Telangana private hospital charges Rs 1.25 lakh for PPE kits
details.content:
Srikara Hospital allegedly charged the patient over Rs 1 lakh a day for Covid-19 treatment. In the said video, a patient’s attendant was complaining at the employees of the hospital about how the hospital administration abused him and his family due to billing related issues.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.content:

details.title: BBMP divides Bengaluru city into ‘cells’ for better COVID-19 monitoring, testing
details.content:
Volunteers visit a patient’s house and use the Karnataka State Remote Sensing Applications Centre (KSRSAC) to get the GPS location of the patient which is used to update information on each cell. From July 30 till August 9, around 10,000 GPS locations of Covid-positive patients have been uploaded by field teams.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: 93 fresh cases, one death in Maharashtra Police Force
details.content: Maharashtra Police force on Monday recorded 93 new COVID-19 positive cases and one death. The total number of cases in the state police force stands at 12,383.

details.title: India reports highest-ever single day recoveries
details.content: India on Monday reported highest-ever single day recoveries with as many as 57,584 COVID-19 patients getting cured and discharged in the last 24 hours. So far 19,19,842 persons have recovered taking the recovery rate to over 72%, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said.

details.title: More patients in home isolation than in hospitals in Puducherry
details.content: More COVID-19 patients are now in home isolation than in hospitals as the number of cases went past 8000 in the Union territory. While 1596 COVID-19 patients are admitted in hospitals, 1692 are in home isolation. (READ MORE)

details.title: Himachal Pradesh's COVID count reaches 4,156
details.content: With single highest day rise of 163 coronavirus cases in Himachal Pradesh, the state COVID-19 count has reached 4,156, said the state health department on Monday.

details.title: Bihar government extends lockdown till September 6
COVID-19 cases doubled faster in Mumbai last week: BMC
details.content: The coronavirus cases doubled at a faster rate in Mumbai last week as compared to the previous week and the average growth rate of the viral infection also went up, according to the city civic body.

details.title: Susanta Singh first Odisha minister to test positive for virus
details.content: Rural Development and Labour Minister Susanta Singh has tested positive for Covid-19. He is the first minister from Odisha to have been infected with the virus. (READ MORE)

details.title: Union Minister Meghwal  recovers from COVID-19
details.content: Union Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal who tested negative for coronavirus was discharged from AIIMS on Monday.

details.title: COVID-19 cases in Indore cross 10,000-mark
details.content: The total number of COVID-19 cases in Indore crossed the 10,000-mark as 245 more people tested positive for the disease in the Madhya Pradesh district in last 24 hours, an official said on Monday.

details.content:

details.title: KSRT to operate special services to Kerala on Onam
details.content: Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation to operate special services to Kerala on Onam festival, from 24th August to 6th September from Bengaluru and Mysuru to various places of Kerala.

details.title: DMK chief slams TN govt's move to reopen TASMACs even as cases surge
details.content: DMK chief MK Stalin slammed the Tamil Nadu government's decision to reopen TASMACs in Chennai amid rise in COVID-19 cases. He said," TASMACs have a huge role to play for the spread of COVID-19 across the state of Tamil Nadi. The government is only bothered about making money.

details.title: UP govt uses call data records of patients to trace COVID-19 contacts
details.content: Call Data Records (CDRs), used in crime investigation by police, are being analysed across Uttar Pradesh to trace contacts of COVID-19 patients, officials say. (READ MORE)

details.title: 36 patients in Hyderabad mental hospital test positive, docs allege lack of PPE kits
details.content: Thirty-six patients admitted to the Erragadda Mental Hospital here have tested positive for COVID-19. They were admitted to the closed wards of the hospital where 200 other patients are admitted. Hospital authorities are now conducting tests on all the 200 patients. (READ MORE)

details.title: Chennithala urges Kerala HC not to allow collection of patients' call records
details.content: Kerala opposition leader Ramesh Chennithala on Monday approached the Kerala High Court seeking a directive to the state police chief not to collect call detail records (CDRs) of COVID-19 patients from any service providers. (READ MORE)

details.title: Bengal to observe September 1 as 'Police Diwas' to honour frontline workers
details.content: West Bengal to observe September 1 as 'Police Diwas' to pay respect to all the cops who are working for the people during this pandemic, CM Mamata Banerjee said.

details.title: Trivandrum prison turns into hotbed as 114 more people test positive
details.content: In a serious concern for officials at the Central prison in Thiruvananthapuram, 114 more people have tested positive for COVID-19 after rapid antigen tests on Monday taking the total number of infected persons to 476. (READ MORE)

details.title: Kerala local body polls not to be postponed
details.content: The election to local self-governments in the state will be held adhering to the COVID-19 protocol. The local body polls will not be postponed in view of the COVID-19 scenario. However, the date of the election will be finalised only after high-level discussions. (READ MORE)

details.title: Global update | UK urges Indians, ethnic minorities to sign up for vaccine trials
details.content: The UK government on Monday issued an appeal for more people from an ethnic minority background, including those of Indian-origin, to sign up for ongoing clinical trials for a potential vaccine to combat COVID-19.(READ MORE)

details.title: Chandigarh tally at 2216
details.content: Total COVID-19 cases in Chandigarh rises to 2216, including 1183 cured till date and 30 deaths, said the Health Department.

details.title: WATCH| Karnataka family forced to carry dead man on bicycle
Thousands party in water park sans masks in COVID-19 epicentre Wuhan
details.content: The popular Wuhan Maya Beach Water Park was filled with people frolicking in swimsuits and goggles for an electronic music festival, many perched on rubber dinghies or wading up to their chest in water. (READ MORE)

details.title: Surat now better placed to defeat COVID-19: Gujarat government tells HC
details.content: Surat is better positioned now to defeat the coronavirus pandemic than last month as reflected in encouraging signs like drop in growth rate of new cases, doubling rate and deaths besides more testing, the state government told the Gujarat High Court on Monday.

details.title: Another TMC MLA dies of Covid-19 in Bengal
details.content: Trinamool Congress MLA Samaresh Das (74) died at a Kolkata hospital in Salt Lake around a month after he had tested positive for Covid-19. Das is the second TMC member of the West Bengal legislative assembly to die of the viral infection. Earlier, three-time party MLA and treasurer Tamonash Ghosh (60) died of the Covid-19 infection. (READ MORE)

details.title: Single day surge of 1,725 COVID-19 cases in Kerala
details.content: Kerala reported the highest single day surge of 1,725 COVID-19 cases on Monday, taking the infection tally to 46,140 while 13 deaths took the toll to 169. Health minister K K Shailaja said Thiruvananthapuram reported the highest number of 461, followed by Malappuram with 306. (READ MORE)

details.title: COVID-19 patient dies after jumping off second floor of hospital in Amritsar
details.content: A 46-year-old man who was undergoing treatment for coronavirus infection at a hospital here ended his life by allegedly jumping off the second floor of the building, police said. Swaran Singh, a resident of village Sandhpur of Tarn Taran district, was admitted to the Government Medical College's Guru Nanak Dev Hospital on August 15, they said

details.title: UK launches £1.5 million fund in Karnataka to fight COVID-19, green threats
details.content: In order to help scientists in academia and industry tackle the two most acute global challenges -- COVID 19 and the threat to our environment -- the UK government has launched a £1.5 million Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Data Innovation Challenge Fund in Karnataka. (READ MORE)

details.title: West Bengal reports record 3,080 new COVID-19 cases, 45 deaths
details.content: West Bengal's COVID-19 tally rose to 1,19,578 with the highest single-day spike of 3,080 new cases on Monday, as per an official bulletin. The toll increased to 2,473 as 45 more people died, the bulletin issued by the Health Department said. Total 2,932 people recovered from the disease during the last 24 hours, improving the discharge rate to 75. 02, it added.

details.title: Liquor shops set to reopen in Chennai, suburbs on Tuesday
details.content: Amid criticism from the Opposition parties, the government has decided to reopen over 800 liquor outlets in Chennai and its suburbs on Tuesday. The shops will reopen after they were shut since March 25 due to the lockdown to control Covid-19 spread. (READ MORE)

details.title: Liquor shops set to reopen in Chennai, suburbs on Tuesday
details.content: Amid criticism from the Opposition parties, the government has decided to reopen over 800 liquor outlets in Chennai and its suburbs on Tuesday. The shops will reopen after they were shut since March 25 due to the lockdown to control Covid-19 spread. (READ MORE)

details.title: COVID-19 case tally rises over 26.47 lakh in India, death toll crosses 50,000
details.content: With 57,981 new cases, India's COVID-19 tally rose to 26,47,663 on Monday, while the death toll due to the disease crossed the 50,000-mark with 941 fresh fatalities, according to the Union health ministry. The number of people who have recuperated from COVID-19 in India also went past 19 lakh on Monday with a record 57,584 patients recovering within a span of 24 hours.

details.title: Pune is new hotspot for total COVID-19 cases but not mortality rate: Survey
details.content: In a sero-survey, it has been found that Pune is a new hotspot of COVID-19 patients in Maharashtra. The infection rate has reached almost upto 65 per cent in some pockets of the city against 57 per cent in Mumbai. However, Pune Municipal Corporation got solace in the mortality rate that is lesser than the state capital.(READ MORE)

details.title: Biocon executive chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw tests positive for COVID-19
details.content: Executive chairperson of Bengaluru-headquartered Biocon Ltd Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw said on Monday night that she has tested positive for COVID-19. "I have added to the covid count by testing positive. Mild symptoms and I hope it stays that way," the 67-year-old biotechnology industry veteran said in a tweet.

details.title: Bengal launches 'COVID Patient Management System' to deal with admissions at hospitals
details.content: The West Bengal government on Monday launched a COVID Patient Management System to deal with admission and treatment-related issues at the hospitals. Addressing a press conference, Chief Secretary Rajiva Sinha said the system has been started with three COVID hospitals in Kolkata, and in another week 84 hospitals in the state will be brought under its purview. (READ MORE)
